snippet: The giant insurer outraged customers by proposing a 40 percent rise in some premiums a few years ago. Nowadays, it has emerged as the biggest participant in state marketplaces.
abstract: Private health insurer WellPoint, former critic of new health care law, has emerged as biggest participant in newly created state marketplaces, capturing leading share of the market in at least half-dozen states; story of how company went from health care opponent to beneficiary provides look at how industry is changing, and potentially thriving, under Affordable Care Act.
lead_paragraph: The giant insurer outraged customers by proposing a 40 percent rise in some premiums a few years ago. Nowadays, it has emerged as the biggest participant in state marketplaces.

headline.main: WellPoint, a Onetime Critic of Health Law, May Yet Profit
headline.print_headline: Ex-Critic of Health Law May Yet Profit

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
